headline: D.R. Horton Weighs Trump Homes Role And Revenue Mix Impact
summary: D.R. Horton (NYSE:DHI) and other large U.S. homebuilders are proposing a plan to develop nearly 1,000,000 "Trump Homes." The initiative focuses on entry level, affordable homes paired with a pathway to ownership program. The proposal is framed as a response to the U.S. housing affordability crisis and could influence future housing policy discussions. D.R. Horton is one of the biggest players in U.S. homebuilding, with a strong presence among first time homebuyers across many regions. A...

headline: Toll Brothers, IBD Stock Of The Day, Approaches Buy Point Amid Trump-Fueled Rally
summary: Toll Brothers is Tuesday's IBD Stock Of The Day, with the luxury homebuilder rallying in stock market action amid reports there are plans for a massive program address housing affordability.  This comes as homebuilding stocks caught fire in early January after President Donald Trump directed Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac to buy $200 billion worth of mortgage-backed securities to lower the spread between the 10-year Treasury yield and 30-year mortgage rate.  Toll Brothers has been a group standout, with its focus on the luxury part of the market appearing to help  it navigate tougher consumer fundamentals for moderate-income households.

headline: US homebuilders working on plan to develop as many as 1 million ‘Trump Homes,' Bloomberg News reports
summary: Feb 3 (Reuters) - Homebuilders are working on a proposal to develop nearly a million "Trump Homes" that would address the U.S. affordability crisis, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday.

headline: 2 Large-Cap Stocks for Long-Term Investors and 1 We Avoid
summary: Large-cap stocks usually command their industries because they have the scale to drive market trends. The flip side though is that their sheer size can limit growth as expanding further becomes an increasingly challenging task.

headline: D.R. Horton, Inc. (DHI): A Bull Case Theory
